snippet: The loss of tropical rain forests is likely to reduce the energy output of hydroelectric projects for countries whose economies depend on them.
abstract: Study published by The Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences predicts that loss of tropical rain forests is likely to reduce energy output of hydroelectric projects in countries like Brazil, which are investing billions of dollars to create power to support economic growth; report shows that extensive deforestation will leave less water in rivers to generate hydropower.
lead_paragraph: The loss of tropical rain forests is likely to reduce the energy output of hydroelectric projects for countries whose economies depend on them.

headline.seo: Study Finds Loss of Rain Forests Can Deplete Hydropower
headline.main: Fewer Rain Forests Mean Less Energy for Developing Nations, Study Finds
headline.print_headline: Deforestation Hurts Energy From Rivers, Study Finds

keywords.value: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences
keywords.name: organizations
